review:
Review 1: Running google apps I ran some of my android apps and worked great on my PC. I notice you're not able to use Google Apps yet on Pc? I only noticed that the hangout dialer app shows up that is Google Android. When I unpacked the extension on Chrome it opened up but will not work unless hangouts app is working with it. Which is understandable but none the less I got excited lol.. Any update on when we will be able to use Google Android Apps on Chrome PC?

Review 2: Worked great on the first app I tried! Was a little confusing at first b/c i hadnt run across the helpful link in the details section...doh! lol but clicked around and got it to work. The only question I have is if there is a way to resize the window that the app runs in. Would love to be able to enlarge it to the size of my screen. but its still cool to be able to run the android app on my computer!

Review 3: Wow. Got my favourite Android SW (MLO 2) running on Chromebook. I am subtracting 1 star since the whole process of installing the extension on the Chromebook is not totally straightforward. But once you read through the provided documentation and got it running  it really works! Fantastic!

Review 4: Incredible I wanted to run Paprika on my chromebook  as there is no web client for the recipe service. Using this app  and the related chrome extensions  it took about 10 minutes to get everything figured out and working. Pretty incredible. Many thanks  and great work!

Review 5: Revolutionary This has let me port several apps to my computers without the need of emulating android for each task  speaking of each task this also allows the chromium ui to run multiple instances!!!

Review 6: Pretty cool Can run android apps with ARChon extension. This app properly sets the manifest.json and has proper app icon compared to the chromeos-apk conversion utility or twerk for chrome.

Review 7: Solid!!! Had it then uninstalled. Came back  tried again  and got outstanding results. This complements my Chromebook well  and it does what it says it's intended for.

Review 8: Great app Aap is great  just one thing is missing that can improve the experience of using android apps on PC and that is option to scale them till the full screen

Review 9: Running """"""""""""""""TV Listings"""""""""""""""" on chromebook now! Much easier than the """"""""""""""""adb backup"""""""""""""""" route too!""

Review 10: Flipboard works WhatsApp doesnt Sadly WhatsApp doesn't work. If you happen to get it working do let me know. Other than that its really neat.

review:
Review 1: If you create an app to help contributors at least you gotta use the right term references for the right elements and tags. Example: having a bicycle icon on an add ""track"" button whereas the track tag is designed for unmaintained ways such as agricultural ways on fields or forests. Just adds confusion and doesn't help the project!

Review 2: Won't upload now Marshmallow on S7 Edge : OpenStreeetmap upload is broken. Hit 'Upload to OpenStreeetmap"""""""""""""""" after scoring tags etc.  and I get taken to a map for 0 lat and 0 long  without file uploading. Sadly  not much user without upload. Otherwise  have used this so for years on previous phones and loved it.""

Review 3: I'm done. How to close exit quit? The only way to quit is to uninstall. Trying now. Where is quit or exit button. I don't want it to auto run. I want to play for 5 mins  then exit and maybe never run it again. Like most other apps. But I can't find the quit or exit button. It's like a bad girlfriend that won't leave.

Review 4: How do you exit this app? If I have to force stop it (can't swipe it closed  no easy menu option to close it)... the design is BAD. zero stars. Sorry  not negotiable  despite any other features

Review 5: Lol  worst UI I've ever seen... Sorry  no  I've seen worse. On Windows 3.11 back in 1991 :D otherwise  works pretty well.
summary: Reviews:  "Lol  worst UI I've ever seen... Sorry  no  I've seen worse. On Windows 3.11 back in 1991 :D otherwise  works pretty well. Otherwise  have used this so for years on previous phones and loved it.""

review:
Review 1: Good for surveying - particularly recorded notes and tracing routes. Sometimes hard to stop it tracking  but it does the job well. I use it for surveys on foot  bicycle  and bus. It's easy to use  and easy to upload the data to OSM and to export the data for other applications. I get an API Key Required message when I use OpenCycleMap as the background tiles.

Review 2: Works Sometimes hard to stop it tracking  but it does the job well. I use it for surveys on foot  bicycle  and bus. It's easy to use  and easy to upload the data to OSM and to export the data for other applications.

Review 3: Useful app Very good app! Its very useful. Would be greater if it was using also downloaded offline maps such as google  here maps etc.

Review 4: Simple and effective If the battery of the phone runs out the tracking is not lost; it simply pauses and it can resume when rebooting

Review 5: Huawei mediapad Great for exploring 4wd tracks. Would like to see notes I've recorded shown on the map instead of yellow stars.

Review 6: If you could easily store and view map tiles offline this would be the perfect app

Review 7: Love it Used to map land uses  road signs  bridges etc while traveling

Review 8: Just waths needed Love it. Use it for all my OSM surveying

Review 9: Works well  a nice app  and allows customisation.

Review 10: Good Simple for non techies to use.
summary: Reviews:  Good for surveying - particularly recorded notes and tracing routes. It's easy to use and easy to upload the data to OSM and to export the data for other applications. If the battery of the phone runs out the tracking is not lost; it simply pauses.

review:
Review 1: How to update binaries I got a notification about su binaries needed to updated. I tapped it then it launched the app and nothing happened. It didn't update binaries like supersu would  but instead it launched the app normally like I launched it from the home screen. But now my root isn't working  and there's nothing in settings or anything on how to fix

Review 2: Can't update su binary Keeps telling me the su binary needs to be updated. Tapping the notification brings me to a mostly blank screen within this app. I see no option to update my binary from in there. Root seems to be working just fine.

Review 3: In need of a UI update ASAP. It will be 2017 in some days... When you set the option for """"""""auto-accept/deny"""""""" root  the POPUP window shouldn't pop... up. Fix this bug - it exists from the Ice Cream(4.0) era in CyanogenMod.""

Review 4: In need of a UI update ASAP. It will be 2017 in some days... When you set the option for """"""""auto-accept/deny"""""""" root  the POPUP window shouldn't pop... up. Fix this bug - it exists from the Ice Cream(4.0) era in CyanogenMod.""

Review 5: Replacement for SuperSU Since hearing that Chinafire sold himself to an unknown Chinese shell company  I've been suspicious of SuperSU. If the prompt could be a pop-up  it would be one huge improvement!

Review 6: Great app but lacks some of the functions that chainfires supersu app has  such as mount namespace setting. I have to keep supersu installed along with this app just for that ONE function.

Review 7: Great functionality. Terrible interface. It tells me the su binary is out of date. In the app there is no ability to update it. Also  there is no option to uninstall root.

Review 8: How to update binary Every time i turn the pad on it ask me to update the binary files  but i can't seem to find it in the app. Where is the update binary function?

Review 9: Keeps telling me su binary is out of date but I see no options in app to perform said update. Tried to find a flashable one online  so such luck yet.

Review 10: Good  but need to improve It works best with Magisk. But I think the UI of this app is not friendly as SuperSU's and should be improved
summary: Me.phh.superuser is a replacement for SuperSU. Users can't update the binary files. There is no option to uninstall root. It works best with Magisk. But the UI of this app is not friendly as SuperSU's and should be improved.

review:
Review 1: Works very well as does Android Pay on a rooted phone. UPDATE: Last night after rebooting my phone  I got a message that superuser's binary needed to be updated?? I had then lost root. Everything else seemed fine  but even rebooting didn't restore root and there was no apparently way to """"""""""""""""fix"""""""""""""""" or """"""""""""""""update"""""""""""""""" it. This morning  I reflashed the magisk v6 zip file in TRWP  rebooted back to Recovery and flashed the phh-supersuer-17-magisk.zip file and then rebooted and it was back to normal. Note that the root checker sees root  but not the binaries but root is working just fine.""

Review 2: Great with Magisk As a long-time SuperSU user  I've been quite pleased with my transition to using this version of Superuser. Bundled with Magisk it has been a perfect option for root access to my device without compromising some of the built in features of the latest and greatest Android versions. I'd highly recommend giving this a try if you're looking into Magisk at all... even if you aren't looking at Magisk!

Review 3: Great workaround for root goodness I did notice that root was lost after I rebooted my phone (for another reason)  but after a little tinkering around I found if you go into phone settings then developers options and change the root setting from whatever it's on to a different setting then root is restored ..BTW I'm on galaxy note 2 running cm13 rom ......G2KEA ..pika pika.

Review 4: It does the job and more.. Works great with Magisk  can support tap to pay compared to SuperSU and others. Works great  never had a problem with root and root apps so far... Those people asking the Binaries must not have flashed the Zip file via recovery

Review 5: Amazing - after chainfire decided to transfer ownership to a relatively unknown company I decided to give this app a try and this works surprisingly well. A small improvement - the su request should be a pop up rather than a full screen prompt.

Review 6: Open Source Options! So glad to have a good open source option for root on Android again. Good on the developer for caring  I hope there is a way I can donate to further development.

Review 7: Works well! After Chainfire sold SuperSU out to a shadowy shell company I ran into this. With the proper zip flashed this works with every su-requesting app I've tried with it.

Review 8: Almost there. Still fiddly when handling root requests from certain apps  ie. V4A  AdAway  etc but all in all amazing root manager app. Feels more lightweight than Chainfire's.

Review 9: 🤘 Certain root apps previously not working with systemless root are good to go  AP accepting transactions; real forward thinking collaboration with Magisk. Thanks  y'all

Review 10: Works great I used supersu in the past and had no complaints but switched to phh after flashing magisk. Works great so far with no problems on my galaxy j510
summary: Me.phh.superuser is an open source root manager app. It works with Magisk, SuperSU, V4A, AdAway and other apps. The app works with Android Pay. It is free and available on Google Play.

review:
Review 1: Could be more user-friendly It's a good working app  but I miss some fearures: There should be a way to let the user decide to which directory a repository should be cloned (and maybe a button to open that folder). I also miss a feature to copy the URL of an existing repository and to backup/restore it's settings. And my last suggestion: Add a log screen  because error messages (toasts) like """"""""""""""""pull failed"""""""""""""""" are not helpful  the user likes to know WHY.""

Review 2: Welcome Back (under new management)! NEW: Most issues fixed. I will test it out and update my review later. OLD: I have the same complaints as everyone else: why can't I specify my own local directory  etc. But  as it hasn't been updated in at least a year and a half  I'll have to wave off potential buyers - look elsewhere. I cannot recommend this app until some of the complaints are addressed.

Review 3: But could be better I would use this instead of pocket git if I could chose the local path of each repository and use the external sd. Edit: I still can't use the external sd because the file explorer doesn't have .. (go dir up) and also can't write the full path directly. Why doesn't it let me just write the path?

Review 4: Decent client  could be better I'm mildly disappointed that it doesn't seem to support two-factor authentication  and every time I go to add a repo over ssh it's kind of a guessing game to remember the correct format for the repo location. Other than that it works well.

Review 5: Why can't you choose where you want to pull a repository ? Also keeps crashing on Nexus 5 - 6.0.1 Edit: Thank for the update  just checked the new version. The local path is just a text field  why not use a pick folder dialog?

Review 6: won't authenticate with my private git repositories  using standard password SSH authentication  hosted on Debian 7 via ssh. this makes it impossible to use.

Review 7: Unsupported peace of sh..t
summary: Me.sheimi.sgit is a free, open-source git clone tool for Android and iOS. The app has been updated in the last year and a half. There are a number of complaints that need to be addressed before the app can be recommended to users.

review:
Review 1: Update: won't run on 6.0 Update 8/16 working great on 6.0 now. Great app. Just got a Nexus 6p (Android 6.0) and the app wont even open. Please fix soon. (Updated) 11/15. I doubt I'll submit much code from my phone or even tablet but awesome for peer reviews and code browsing.

Review 2: SGit is a stable  feature rich Open Source Git client. I would have preferred ASL v2 rather than GPLv3 license. Together with LugaLabs Source Code viewer and K9 Mail  this makes for a fantastic trio ! Thanks Rizhen Zhang for sharing this software with the community.

Review 3: Great app. Earlier I complained about lack of edit capability. Turns out that authors do document local repo path in notes  and the message I was getting was from the system not from sgit. So  this has everything I need  great app  i recommend it

Review 4: Working on 6 again. I do have one feature request now  import an existing repo already on the storage. Great support when it finally came :) edit: it does indeed  can you tell the difference when importing as external repo?

Review 5: Thanks for making it possible to push hotfixes while on the go :-) Managing a repo and editing code on a phone is never going to be a pleasurable experience  but this app (coupled with VimTouch) is as good as it gets!

Review 6: Needs to be more flexible This is a solid app and with the option to specify the top level folder in the latest version  it provides the perfect complement to programming apps that are not git-aware.

Review 7: This app really did the good job. Unfortunedly it doesn't support ART in Kitkat.. Please dev  We can't hardly wait to see the updates for kitkat users with ART... I just edited my stars..

Review 8: Very good app Works very well and is very intuitive. Could not push to repo when 2FA is enabled in my account  tho. App does not understand SSH either.

Review 9: Glad to see it back This is definitely the best git client for Android. The new developers seem intent to keep it updated and supported.

Review 10: nice app  but need t0 have a feature that we create a repo to/from another place in the storage like from external memory
summary: Me.sheimi.sgit is an open source Git client for Android. It is available on the Google Play Store. The app is not compatible with Android 6.0 or above. There are a number of positive reviews of the app.

review:
Review 1: Simple Counter is exactly what it says in the title  a simple tally counter app. The feature to count is there with buttons to add or remove from the counter. There are more features though  with the ability to store multiple counters  edit the number in the counter  value reset  and volume buttons to use for counting. As a free and open source app  Simple Counter does what it does well with very straightforward and direct tools for tally counting with a simple yet useful mindset.

Review 2: Simple but needs ability to swipe between lists Heavily relies on a hamburger menu & needs ability to swipe between counters. Other improvements could include negative counting  grouping of counters  counter interactions (e.g.  2 counters can be linked & a rule set so that when the first counter reaches 10  the second counter increments by 1). Otherwise  this is a good simple material design app with multiple counters & even a dark mode!

Review 3: Brilliant app! Material UI - the best for Android apps. Works very well  no issue. Ability to block screensaver is awesome. Might recommend to have an option to reset without warning  as well as ability to enter the number to increase/decrease by (on button long press and/or on specific counter properties - the step).

Review 4: Simple! You press a button and it counts. Mistakes are correctable. Values can be manually overwritten. The volume buttons can be used as shortcuts. With no ads and free use as icing on the cake  this is a quality app that does only exactly what you need it to do  reliably and easily.

Review 5: Great for Shiny hunting in Pokemon! This app lets you make multiple counters that you can bounce back and forth between so it is perfect for tracking all the different shinies that I hunt for in increments! It works like a charm and the feedback options are awesone!

Review 6: Love physical feedback! Not only the button is physical (+/- button)  but here are neat feedbacks w/ short vibration to ensure the confident feeling that your device actually counted each one push on the button. You cannot count with mistake with this solid one.

Review 7: Simple and nice Best app to count. UI looks clean and interactive. One input I wanna give is the sound option for the button click is not working properly. That's not a major issue but I wanted you to notice it. Great job. Keep doing simple apps like this.

Review 8: Copy button for perfection Just add a little copy button at the top pls then it will be perfect. And if you can give the option of dividing the + & - buttons left-right respectively with the - button smaller  so theres no more need to look while clicking

Review 9: USEFUL FOR SOFT RESETTING SHINY POKEMON It helped me a ton on counting how many soft resets I did on trying to make a shiny Cresselia appear  I even love it cause it saves the number of counts even when the app is killed/force stop  thanks alot!

Review 10: Wonderful App For Shiny Hunting! The app is simple to use  and for people who shiny hunt or anything of that sort  it's perfect. You can easily track the SR's you've completed. And it couldn't get better at the fact that THERE IS NO ADS!
summary: Simple Counter is a free and open source app that does what it does well with very straightforward and direct tools for tally counting with a simple yet useful mindset. With no ads and free use as icing on the cake  this is a quality app thatdoes only exactly what you need it to do.

review:
Review 1: Does what other md Apps don't. Folder root is configurable  doesn't truncate long texts  gives a handy bar with markdown relevant symbols so no need to find these on your keyboard. First world troubles: green and orange are horrible UI colours. Will use this for a couple of days and see if this is my Android markdown editor.

Review 2: Edited since Gooqle limited characters 1. Issue with not keeping file current (hit back button then went back to file  edits not shown but were saved). 2. Issue with adding md extension to everything  including a pdf file accidentally clicked on. Since md extension hidden I was unaware of this.

Review 3: You will need to tap 5 times just to get started writing. Bad design.

Review 4: I really don't like it it is just so hard to use!

Review 5: No cloud sync  not that useful.
summary: Reviews of 'me.writeily' on Android. Use bullets to highlight the Negative aspects of the app. Summarize the following reviews about the app into a concise paragraph. Use the 'Reviews' section to help you understand the reviews.

review:
Review 1: Very Good Note taking/editing app This is a very Good Note taking/editing app . Markdown support  yeah.. I'm enjoying it. Thanks Devs  keep up the good work. Only a small *bug*  sometimes cursor jumps randomly. And could you please add sort button on Folders/Files window.. Sort by date/title  etc.. Thanks.

Review 2: App is like cavas paint as you like I use it for mind mapping  thought organising  into imp less imp  6 thinking hats name it this app can be used as it. Folder text structure is very flexible can be transfered on other mobile pc and just rename .md to .txt thats all

Review 3: Good work! Nice looking  simple and efficient markdown note-taking app. A great companion for Synthing to manage my notes on my phone and my tablet. Suggestions: one smaller option for the font and a searching by name option that can look for files into the folders.

Review 4: Open source  nice! there are a few bugs here and there  and a few missing features I'd appreciate (easier image and other tag insertion  some checkbox simulation  folder coloring  github flavor)  but overall a decent markdown editor

Review 5: :) Perfect replacement for my default note app. Easy to use. Could you add undo function and also a way to move files up and down (when you have many files in a folder)?

Review 6: Not too bad Needs some more features to become a really good app (such as look nice on tablet screen size  smoother view/edit transitions)  but otherwise good app.

Review 7: Perfect It simply does what should do. The original website has been closed some days ago. Thanks for taking care of the future of this app!

Review 8: Clean  simple Clean  simple app. Configurable doc root. Nice. Would like to be able to save docs with .txt extension.

Review 9: Great   and if added web synchronization like with Google account would be magnificent

Review 10: New to the world of markdown and have tried numerous editors; this is the best!
summary: The original website has been closed some days ago. The app is free and open-source. There are a few bugs here and there and a few missing features I'd appreciate. I use it for mind mapping  thought organising into imp less imp 6 thinking hats name it.

review:
Review 1: at least the option isn't there. does have option for normal SMS  which for some reason doesn't work. it does work with whatsapp and line. oh...and I second the opinion on the bad icon design: use solids for such a small icon  simplify too  and use an eye catching color different from the most common communication programs installed so us users can easily pick it out of the dozen or so applications. Update 2016 After using it for a while  found it does work with hangout  however due to the limitations of sms  only one image at a time. It does work well with all other apps. Great handy utility!

Review 2: Highly recommended It is a highly useful utility and does what it claims. Developer responds to issues and helped me resolve a problem with not being able to select the application to send with. For those with the same problem  where send reduced always opens with a certain app but you would like to be able to select the app  try Settings (the main Android settings)  Applications  Application Manager  the application that always opens with send reduced e.g. Outlook  Viber  etc  then """"""""""""""""Set as default""""""""""""""""  and """"""""""""""""clear defaults"""""""""""""""".""

Review 3: Fantastic app! Very helpful and useful indeed! However I have a request... Please add UI for resetting default app. Once selected there is no way to change it. At least I cannot find it.

Review 4: Awsome Used it 1 day. This is so simple - totally see through. Just reduces pic size and """"""""forwards"""""""" to email. No hassle Im buying pro now""

Review 5: I found it to be really useful! Saves your Mb when on mobile data and need to send photos. Very easy to use and versatile. Great thought and project!

Review 6: Great app Awesome app. Just one request: could you add a feature allowing for the selection of several photos at once?

Review 7: Easy & effective I like the minimum of keystrokes. I wish everyone sending me bloat-size photos would use this.

Review 8: Very easy to use app that does exactly what it says. This should be a feature in Android like it is in iOS.

Review 9: Easy to use Would like it if I had a choice to msg or email. It defaults to the same app each time.

Review 10: Must have for slow connections Perfect for emailing photos. Many thanks to the developers
summary: Mobiomegacentauri.SendReduced is a mobile app that reduces the size of photos by up to 50 per cent. The app is free and available on Google Play for Android and iOS. Users can choose which app they want to send photos with.

review:
Review 1: [SOLVED] Broken root call for hiding the icon. Broken request for the root function to hide the status bar icon. It's annoying as hell and if I have the root I can obviously see the logs.Seems like Roundr has a broken call function for the root on SuperSU. Fix it and this small app will be great. Until then  I'm rating 4 stars cause of this nuance. Will write to you on XDA so you can see if everything is ok with code or it's my setup to blame. Edit: left a re in your thread hopping it's useful to you. Edit2: Solved the issue with notification icon and status with xposed module  rating upped to 5 stars :)

Review 2: Dangerous  No Developer Contact Point First  recently  when waking from screen-off (NOT necessarily lock)  screen becomes super dark but backlight still visible. No touch controls recognized. Only solution - long press Power button  and cold reboot. Second; in developer contact I am taken to xda entry which is a long page singing the praise of the developer  or download.. No entry to log bug reports  or contacting developer. Impressive but not useful in case of """"""""""""""""issues"""""""""""""""".""

Review 3: Moto x kit Kat bug There's an option to hide the rounded corners on the kit Kat home screen because of the transparent notifications bar and the transparent bottom home/back/multitask bar. This option does not work in moto x running kit Kat. This is stopping me from buying the pro since the home really looks messed up because of that. Otherwise everything else is perfect and gives a brilliant aesthetic appeal otherwise. Cheers!

Review 4: disabling roundr on kitkat home hi  i have been using this app since past 6 months without any issues. but recently when i updated to kitkat the home screen wasn't looking pretty. how do we disable the roundr for kitkat home screen   keeping it enabled else where. ps: i tried the settings there was an option  """"""""""""""""disable on kitkat home screen""""""""""""""""  it didn't do anything""

Review 5: Still doesn't work with kitkat Not entirely the app's fault but it just plain ugly on kitkat. transparent nav bar and notification bar mess the transition to home screen up big time. it is also not always persistent so you'll see a lot of sharp corners transforming to rounded all the time

Review 6: Useless and ugly The desing is very  very bad. This is because the corners round at the edges  but the status bar isn't rounded. This makes it look awefull in apps that support the statusbar color (e.g. google play  samsung print services  etc...). I would advise against downloading it!

Review 7: 25MB of Memory and. 32% cpu used to run this????? I have great and fast phone but 25MB of memory and up to .32% cpu usage seems excessively high for such a simple app. Uninstalling this its not worth the memory or cpu resources to have round edges..... Buh bye

Review 8: Doesn't work anymore.. I recently updated my phone to KK v4.4.4 and also changed my old Launcher to Nova Prime. Unfortunately Roundr stopped working. With Nova Prime I can't get rounded corners anymore no matter the settings I try.. sad..

Review 9: Good job but a few glitches This app is perfect but it messes with the overlay function. So it doesn't allow permissions necessary for other apps. It gives this error 'Overlay detected' Otherwise its a decent app if this issue is fixed.

Review 10: Matches the curved edges on my Xperia Z The the corners do not work on the transparent navigation bar and the rounded corners are placed above the navigation bar making it look unpolished. Would love to see a fix to this problem
summary: Mohammad.adib.roundr has a broken call function for the root on SuperSU. Fix it and this small app will be great. There's an option to hide the rounded corners on the kit Kat home screen because of the transparent notifications bar and the transparent bottom home/back/multitask bar.

review:
Review 1: Great app... with a couple of issues Great app  though there are some things that I wish were different. I wish it worked in the Google Launcher on KitKat and Lollipop. I wish it worked consistently on Lollipop (the rounded corners come and go seemingly randomly). I realize that it can't be applied to the status bar  but if it at least worked on the bottom corners I think the GEL would look better. Also if the rounding could be applied to popup boxes  such as the app drawer  that would be a great enhancement. Overall 4/5 stars!

Review 2: Great application  but the navigation bar? I really appreciate that someone finally mad an app like this. It's a great app  but on my Nexus 6Pit doesn't round the corners on the navigation bar and rounds the corners of the domain above it. So I hope the developer can implement that. And best possible case  choose for each app what corners should be rounded and over the status bar  navigation  bar  just the screen  or in any combination of those options. And another thing is if the icon and app can be updated to material theme.

Review 3: ABANDONED?.. This is a truly great app that seems has been abandoned by the developer as for a very long time already it has not been updated. I've used it for a long time  and has always been one of my favorite Android apps.. but now with newer versions of Android OS  new launchers and a growing number of newer apps  unfortunately I start having several compatibility issues. I wish the developer would still support this app because it really needs to be updated. Anyway  it was fun while it lasted..

Review 4: Nice! Very nice! Found from Drippler.. Very glad they let me know about it! Love the settings that allow for how round you want it.. Overlays all apps as far as I can see. Very cool! :) - Galaxy S3  Jelly Bean 4.1.3  AT&T - Another review stated issues with keyboard enter key bottom right. I have Swiftkey  works great.. I find the 20dp setting just right. UPDATE: 2016  LG V10.. Corners are above bottom menu. Can no longer use Roundr UPDATE 2: LG sucked. Back on Samsung S7 Edge. Still da best app :)

Review 5: I really appreciate that someone finally made an app like this. It's a great app  but on my Nexus 6Pit doesn't round the corners on the navigation bar and rounds the corners of the domain above it. So I hope the developer can implement that. And best possible case  choose for each app what corners should be rounded and over the status bar  navigation  bar  just the screen  or in any combination of those options. And another thing is if the icon and app can be updated to material theme.

Review 6: Beautifully made app Love the app   however it could be better if the nav bar could also incorporate the curve designs   in some UI the nav bar would change colours and if the black borders are there it gives a curvy edged screen feel to it ? the transition of the black piece into the screen is not great thou ? I wish it would be like corner slowly wrapping in and form a round edge instead of a pre-cut black piece PNG sliding upwards

Review 7: Nice! Very nice! Found from Drippler.. Very glad they let me know about it! Love the settings that allow for how round you want it.. Overlays all apps as far as I can see. Very cool! :) - Galaxy S3  Jelly Bean 4.1.3  AT&T - Another review stated issues with keyboard enter key bottom right. I have Swiftkey  works great.. I find the 20dp setting just right. UPDATE: 2016  LG V10.. Corners are above bottom menu. Can no longer use Roundr

Review 8: Works as dilescribed  ALSO TO NOTE: This small yet BIG design changing app  has created a NEW phenomenon within the cellphone market (here's looking at you Samsung S8 and LG G6) looks like if this 'fad' catches one day ALL phones will come with rounded corners! [ Also a side note: I owned the first ever Android phone and it came with Rounded coners... interesting almost 10 years it catches on ]

Review 9: Better than expected It does what it's supposed to  and although it's not a drastic change  I've found it hard not to use it on all of my devices. Really improves the aesthetics without getting in the way  and it doesn't apply the effect to the nav and notification bars or on your home screen. Doesn't look as good if you match your notification color to your applications though.

Review 10: Very good The app works very well and it gives my phone a fancy looking round screen. However  when I set the corners not to overlap the status bar  it looks kinda weird when the status bar doesn't have a solid black color  sometimes it imitates the main color of some apps (like red on YouTube or green on LINE). But overall  this is a very cool app  definitely worth to try.
summary: Mohammad.adib.roundr is an app that allows users to make their phone's navigation bar rounded. The app is available for the Google Launcher on KitKat and Lollipop. The rounded corners come and go seemingly randomly on some versions of Android.

review:
Review 1: Some little bugs and design issues  great otherwise! After installing it  a now playing bar shows up at the bottom and  when touched  shows the now playing page  but blank. Also  in the now playing page  there's no difference between the repeat all and the repeat song icon. And in the first now playing layout and main screen  that animated equalizer icon gives me a feeling like the app lags  because of its low framerate. Besides that  it's an awesome app  you can even choose between multiple now playing layouts!

Review 2: Good start. Improvements primary necessity not aesthetics. Great looking app. A little too good for its own good perhaps. 1. Struggles with animations( option to turn them off available but still no one likes to turn animation off that too when it looks so beautiful). 2. Lacks equiliser  but still a problem that can be overcome easily. 3. Couldn't find a widget which was surprising. There's a lot of scope for this app to be a great hit! Can check our Rocketplayer and blackplayer for further improvements! Atb.

Review 3: It's amazing .... Great app... Please rectify these mistakes! - *I am not able to delete any song ... * I am not able to make a new playlists and add new songs to new playlists!(please add these features!!!) * there are few bugs like - the song title is different from the song which is being played ... (This happens sometimes) *I am not able to open equilizer settings... Whenever I select the option ...nothing happens.... * auto playlists work slowly! Please make these following changes

Review 4: Good start  but needs improvement When the main FAB elevates in the now playing screen the shadow is clipped (like numbers in the same screen with the fourth theme). The status bar becomes way too dark in the album tracklist  and it would be nice to have a choice for color combinations in the app  along with the possibility to have the FAB following the color of the album cover in the now playing screen. The hamburger menu icon is also too small. Overall it's a good start.

Review 5: Still a beta and quite buggy  but beautiful. I really like Timber. It's beautiful  customisable  uses both dark and light status bar icons if your ROM supports it (Xiaomi & Huawei/Honor users (on EMUI 4) will be happy!) It's still quite buggy which reminds you it's still in a beta state. As an example when you skip a track it might still display the previous song's info  the headphones' button does not work with it... But it's still a nice player.

Review 6: Very bare bone While Timber has a nice material design and functions fine  that's about where the compliments end with the application. There are no notable feature that distinguish Timber from any other music app  lacking music ratings  FLAC support  a decent onboard EQ (uses regular system EQ)  or even Chromecast support. You're better off with the more popular options.

Review 7: On LG G Stylos (Timber *BETA*) So far starting out nicely. But dont screw it up and only offer the good options on a paid for version. My biggest issues with music players are Meta Data availability. Must have option to manually AND automatically DL artist images  album art  lyrics...etc. Black Music Player my fav right now...follow their lead.

Review 8: Great potential but bad performance I installed this to compare with my default music player on a Samsung Galaxy S4  and I liked it for the most part. The visuals and customization are fantastic  but it is sadly is very poorly optimized and inefficient. If they could just manage to make it run better I would rate 5 stars.

Review 9: Love the design but needs an update Extremely pleasing to eyes and the functionality and design options r way too good.. But please improve the performance.. Lags many times when I select the now playing screen type 3 with circular seek bar and audio queue below it.. Love this screen type..but causes lots of lags

Review 10: Good!! Good work for the person who do this player... I suggest you to look a style of shuttle music player or in the black player to improve this... by the way i like this i have a 4 music player on my phone this one  shuttle  black player  and music player the one that looks like this !!! Keep up the good work
summary: Timber is a new music player app for the LG G Stylos. The app is still in a beta state. There are a few bugs and design issues, but overall it's a great app. It struggles with animations and lacks equiliser, but still a problem that can be overcome easily.

review:
Review 1: Recent issues A weird glitch keeps happening. Every so often  colors will invert  so everything is white on black. Typically happens if I click in an odd place (like just now it happened when playing Bridges and I tapped just on the edge of a circle  cuz my fingers are clumsy)  but other times it just happens randomly. It's a very hard glitch to replicate and I can't willingly switch it back  but it's been persisting for weeks now.

Review 2: Good but snags After several games it introduces no wins and the touch pad betrays moves to errant moves. Using the Solve feature works well on simple puzzles  but on complex ones becomes confused making box canyon moves from which it cannot remedy. A good game but uninstalled due to the errant moves and no win scenarios -- too much like real life to enjoy the no escape aspect.

Review 3: Lights up logic now avoids offensive shape Really!? Is nothing ever allowed to be random now  for fear of offending someone? Social justice warrior much. For the record  I'm deeply offended by the word 'puzzle'. It goes against my religion  and I look forward to the next update where this app is renamed to not use that deeply despicable word.

Review 4: This Simon douche has the worst tathams  what ever the heck that is  ever! All these puzzles are ripoffs and horribly adapted counterfeits of the nice originals. There aren't even mentions for these! I would give this abomination a 0 out of 5 if I could!!!

Review 5: looks like something developed ten years ago or older not even for Android talking about mouse etc.  not really proper touch screen controls  i am not rating game because i was not able to figure out how to control it even with reading help

Review 6: Love it  bad update The game no longer has the option for sound when you do a long press. Can't tell if i made a selection. Have to keep trying. Very annoying.

Review 7: One suggestion I would like more options for controls. My fat fingers have lost too many games that would have otherwise been personal best times.

Review 8: Awesome  but... I tried 300x300 with 30000 mines but it crashed and wouldn't reopen  reinstalling now  please fix so I can play more minesweeper!

Review 9: No explanation. I wish it would tell you how to play. I understand how to play the games but not sure how to make moves such as code breaker.

Review 10: Perfect What more could you want? I'll miss the rude shapes in some of the puzzles though.
